title: Vy.Finance DeFi Protocol
description: DeFi has a few issues right now, one of which being gas fees, another being a lack of diversity into things besides just currencies.

This proposal does not directly address the challenge's goal of growing and enhancing the Cardano developer community.

We all understand the need for interoperability between chain solutions. However, proposal doesn't really go into detail how this particular solution is worth a while and how big of an impact it can have. How does it align with cardano community, etc. We can make some assumptions but these are elemental features that should be listed in the proposal itself.
a lot of acronyms, but how is that relevant would be great information

The proponent reveals the knowledge required to take on the challenge but more confidense needs to be built into the proposal. Perhaps how the funds will be used and what are the stages of development needed to be outlined to solve the challenge presented.

The plan presented is extremely abstract and without focus. Different ideas are mentioned and it is not possible to understand what is the mission of the proposal. Before understanding the relevance of the team it is necessary to understand what the intention of the project, so that we can judge the ability of the proposer and the team in performing such a project. The proposer described experiences in some companies, but did not describe what its function was in these companies. There is no information about the Skills from the proposer. I recommend the inclusion of such information and greater clarity in the proposal so that we can have objectivity in the evaluation.

The proposal lists an ambitious set to products (a whole ecosystem), but does not demonstrate technical capabilities relevant to those tasks. It does not frame success in terms of KPIs relevant to Cardano developers.

There is no indication of how this proposal plans to be carried out as it lacks a sensible plan. The experience part isn't addressed effectively - as we don't know who the proposers are - their professional background, links, references. Hence we're flying blind. Nor do they explain in any detail how the budget is going to be spent and on what. These are two major elements that are currently missing and need to be addressed. This proposal is simply not investable in its current shape and form.

Im sure there are projects that are alreafy doing the bridging and wrapping to welcome the transitions from the Ethereum network onto the Cardano blockchain. The fees are substantially lower in the Cardano network so developers in those project would already be working on transitioning to the network and hire their own developers who would work on these ends. More clarity on the detailed plan and use of the funds would help voters make an informed decision in the favor of this proposal.
There is no clarity on how the proposal will address the challenge and there is no information to indicate the feasibility of the proposal.

The proposal does not relate the proposed budget to its goals, which are vague and not quantified as KPIs.

Since this is more of a concept - there is little effort to highlight roadmap with milestones. Authors also don't pay any attention how community can validate their efforts through success metrics or KPIs. That would help anchor the proposal in a meaningful way. They also don't discuss challenges or risks. Please, add these things and try to resubmit at later stages with more confidence.
